It's likely one guy with a lot of unused accounts. This has happened many times (I've seen at least twenty of these scams since I joined). 
The person likely puts it as a reply to the top comment to get the most views, upvotes the post with the unused accounts/bots to make it seem popular, has some unused accounts/bots comment that the site is totally legitimate and "it works fine, I got PAX Sivir! so happy" and has bots upvote _those_ comments too, and then downvotes any replies (with bots) that call the site out on its scam.

Luckily, we have excellent moderation here. When the post gets reported, it normally disappears within minutes. One just needs to know _how_ to report, because the News view doesn't show how.
In order to report, one must visit the Boards and go to the [Announcements board](http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/riot-official), which contains links to all Announcements threads. You can visit a thread and report the offending posts in it by using the Report function of the Boards.
Will you be able to play with your friends or is it just solo?
It's a single-player tool. We've focused on something for players to practice their champion mechanics, how to jungle, etc.

I was hoping to see a bit less confidence with this answer, such as "currently" or "for the time being". I personally couldn't imagine a more effective mode for training or guiding a fellow player one-on-one, especially with the elimination of death timers, camp resets, and the like. 

Demonstrating the use of {{item:3152}} to a friend, for example, would require a ton of farming in a custom game; here, you could instantly acquire it. More practically, and unfortunately, we "referral players" have to relegate the majority of our lessons over to some YouTube channel whose author may or may not cover the same information.

Indeed, there's a technical conflict with regards to "Who's in control of the in-game configuration?" So of course, it'd be perfectly appropriate for a single host to run the show.

Don't get me wrong, the potential with this tool is through the roof as it is. But practicing fully-customizable gameplay scenarios _with someone else_? I'm partly inspired by GarrysMod, a sandbox with incredible solo functionality that rather magically translates into multiplayer 95% of the time.

Please consider some research into the possibility, at the very least.

This may seem odd but will this be co-operative. Me and my friends played hide and seek on the old dominion map and it was a blast. You can't play it anymore due to dominion being removed and even when you can play on it, they change how the game works so minions spawn and it messes the game up and on the current summoners rift you have a lot of the same problems. Leveling up, towers, creeps, etc. Being able to play this fun game on summoners rift while not having to run around and get xp from lanes and locking levels would make the game mode playable again and I would love for them to consider making it multiplayer if it isn't or even add hide and seek as a game mode if they could.

It seems like this tool will be restricted from things like that, because Riot doesn't want it to become an alternate game mode where people spend the bulk of their time. This way, it gets people to play the gamemode they have invested the most work into, rather than pushing people to play customs all the time. I think that is folly though. Dota 2 is an extremely successful MOBA, and they have a fully customizable workshop. In fact, the style of game that league is, was created as a custom game in Warcraft. I don't believe it would take away from normals or ranked on Summoner's Rift, I just think it would only benefit Riot, but I'm not Riot, so nothing I say matters.
